data.meanings: to conceal, to cover, to reject, to disbelieve, to be thankless, unthankful, ungrateful, to disown, deny, faithless, black horse, dark night, tiller/farmer. [[Perhaps it should be noted that its primary meaning is to cover/conceal (hence farmer), with active/conscious intent. From this, is born: to reject/disbelieve because this is a conscious decision made by a person. Please note one can only reject something after hearing/seeing/experiencing it, not before.]]
data.sentence: The word لِلْكَافِرِينَ comes from the root ك ف ر and is associated with the meanings: to conceal, to cover, to reject, to disbelieve, to be thankless, unthankful, ungrateful, to disown, deny, faithless, black horse, dark night, tiller/farmer. [[Perhaps it should be noted that its primary meaning is to cover/conceal (hence farmer), with active/conscious intent. From this, is born: to reject/disbelieve because this is a conscious decision made by a person. Please note one can only reject something after hearing/seeing/experiencing it, not before.]]

data.meanings: to be ready, prepared, at hand, provide a thing for the future.
data.sentence: The word أَعْتَدْنَا comes from the root ع ت د and is associated with the meanings: to be ready, prepared, at hand, provide a thing for the future.

data.meanings: to join/chain one thing to another, connect, fetter with manacle, chain.
data.sentence: The word سَلَاسِلَا comes from the root س ل س ل and is associated with the meanings: to join/chain one thing to another, connect, fetter with manacle, chain.

data.meanings: to [make something] enter, clad with, put upon, burning with thirst, became unfaithful, collar, shackle, a thing in which one hides himself, dishonesty, insincerity, revenue from the land
data.sentence: The word وَأَغْلَالًا comes from the root غ ل ل and is associated with the meanings: to [make something] enter, clad with, put upon, burning with thirst, became unfaithful, collar, shackle, a thing in which one hides himself, dishonesty, insincerity, revenue from the land

data.meanings: to light/kindle a fire, made it burn, provoke mischief, to be blasted, fire/blaze/heat/hell/flame, madness/insanity/possessed/demonic, vehement hunger/thirst.
data.sentence: The word وَسَعِيرًا comes from the root س ع ر and is associated with the meanings: to light/kindle a fire, made it burn, provoke mischief, to be blasted, fire/blaze/heat/hell/flame, madness/insanity/possessed/demonic, vehement hunger/thirst.
